pytrino.three_flavor_matter

class pytrino.three_flavor_matter.ThreeFlavor

Bases: object

Cython solver class to compute properties of the three-flavor neutrino oscillation model in vacuum/matter.

angles_phase_matter()

Compute the mixing angles and CP-violating phase in matter.

Parameters:

  • L (float) – Neutrino propagation distance in km.

  • E (float) – Neutrino energy in GeV.

  • V (float) – Matter potential in eV.

  • antineutrinos (bool) – Flag indicating whether the neutrinos are antineutrinos (default is False).

Returns:

The mixing angles and CP-violating phase in matter.

Return type:

Tuple[float, float, float, float]

delmsq21

Getter for the mass-squared difference between the second and first neutrino mass eigenstates in eV^2.

Returns:

The value of delmsq21.

Return type:

float

delmsq31

Getter for the mass-squared difference between the third and first neutrino mass eigenstates in eV^2.

Returns:

The value of delmsq31.

Return type:

float

deltacp

Getter for the CP-violating phase in the neutrino mixing matrix.

Returns:

The value of deltacp.

Return type:

float

deltamsq_matter()

Compute the effective mass-squared differences of the neutrinos in matter.

Parameters:

  • E (float) – Neutrino energy in GeV.

  • V (float) – Matter potential in eV.

  • antineutrinos (bool) – Flag indicating whether the neutrinos are antineutrinos (default is False).

Returns:

The effective mass-squared differences of the neutrinos in matter.

Return type:

Tuple[float, float, float]

probability()

Compute transition and survival probabilities.

Parameters:

  • alpha (int) – Initial neutrino flavor (1, 2, or 3).

  • beta (int) – Final neutrino flavor (1, 2, or 3).

  • L (float) – Neutrino propagation distance in km.

  • E (float) – Neutrino energy in GeV.

  • V (float) – Matter potential in eV.

  • antineutrinos (bool) – Flag indicating whether the neutrinos are antineutrinos (default is False).

Returns:

The transition probability.

Return type:

float

probmatrix()

Compute the oscillation probability matrix.

Parameters:

  • L (float) – Neutrino propagation distance in km.

  • E (float) – Neutrino energy in GeV.

  • V (float) – Matter potential in eV.

  • antineutrinos (bool) – Flag indicating whether the neutrinos are antineutrinos (default is False).

Returns:

The neutrino oscillation probability matrix.

Return type:

List[List[float]]

theta12

Getter for the mixing angle between the first and second neutrino flavor states in radians.

Returns:

The value of theta12.

Return type:

float

theta13

Getter for the mixing angle between the first and third neutrino flavor states in radians.

Returns:

The value of theta13.

Return type:

float

theta23

Getter for the mixing angle between the second and third neutrino flavor states in radians.

Returns:

The value of theta23.

Return type:

float

pytrino.two_flavor_matter

class pytrino.two_flavor_matter.TwoFlavor

Bases: object

Cython solver class to compute properties of a two-flavor neutrino oscillation model.

delmsq

Get the value of delmsq in eV^2.

Returns:

The value of delmsq.

Return type:

float

probability()

Calculate the two flavor neutrino oscillation probability in vacuum/matter.

Parameters:

  • L (float) – The distance traveled by the neutrino in km.

  • E (float) – The neutrino beam energy in GeV.

  • V (float) – The effective (constant) matter potential in eV. Default is 0.

  • antineutrinos (bool) – Whether to compute for antineutrinos (True) or neutrinos (False). Default is False.

Returns:

The probabilities (Pee, Pemu) of oscillations. Note that the other two probabilities can be computed using these as Pmue = Pemu and Pmumu = Pee

Return type:

Tuple[float, float]

theta

Get the value of theta in radians.

Returns:

The value of theta.

Return type:

float
